article:
The Docklands Light Railway (DLR) is an automated light rail system in the
United Kingdom that serves the London Docklands area of east and south-east
London, operated by Transport for London (TfL).

Construction of the DLR was a key component in the regeneration of large parts
of the London Docklands from disused industrial land into valuable commercial
and residential districts. The first part opened in 1987 serving 15 stations,
using redundant railway infrastructure and new construction. The network has
been extended and the capacity of its trains expanded so that now nearly 70
million journeys made every year. Stations are in the City of London
and the boroughs of Newham, Tower Hamlets, Greenwich and Lewisham with the
majority of the network north of the River Thames. __TOC__
categories: Lists of railway stations in London|Stations
